page.title:
Campylobacter
Campylobacter
page.enlisting:
Leading cause of bacterial diarrheal illness in US Estimated 2.4 million cases each year in the US In CA, there were 5,736 cases reported in 2001 Occurs as isolated, sporadic events, not as a part of large outbreaks. Children under five years and young adults (15- 29) are more frequently affected.
Leading cause of bacterial diarrheal illness in US
Estimated 2.4 million cases each year in the US
In CA, there were 5,736 cases reported in 2001
Occurs as isolated, sporadic events, not as a part
of large outbreaks.
Children under five years and young adults (15-
29) are more frequently affected.

page.title:
Transmission
Transmission
page.enlisting:
Contaminated food (particularly poultry) Un-treated water Unpasteurized milk Contact with infected animals (particularly cats and puppies). Can be spread from person to person by the fecal-oral route.
Contaminated food (particularly poultry)
Un-treated water
Unpasteurized milk
Contact with infected animals
(particularly cats and puppies).
Can be spread from person to person by the
fecal-oral route.

page.title:
Poultry and Campylobacter
Poultry and Campylobacter
page.normal_text:
80% of poultry for human consumption is contaminated with Campylobacter.
80% of poultry for
human
consumption is
contaminated with
Campylobacter. C a m p y l o b a c t e r .

page.title:
Symptoms
Symptoms
page.normal_text:
Symptoms of campylobacteriosis usually occur within 2 to 10 days
Symptoms of campylobacteriosis usually occur
within 2 to 10 days
page.enlisting:
Diarrhea (may contain blood or mucus) Fever Nausea Vomiting Abdominal Pain
Diarrhea (may contain blood or mucus)
Fever
Nausea
Vomiting
Abdominal Pain

page.title:
Treatment
Treatment
page.normal_text:
Most infected persons with Campylobacter will recover without any specific treatment.
Most infected persons with Campylobacter M o s t
i n f e c t e d
p e r s o n s
w i t h
C a m p y l o b a c t e r
will recover without any specific treatment.

In severe cases, antibiotics can be used.
In severe cases, antibiotics can be used.

page.title:
Complications
Complications
page.enlisting:
Meningitis Urinary tract infections Septicemia Reactive arthritis (rare and almost always short-term) Guillain-Barre syndrome, an unusual type of paralysis (rare).
Meningitis
Urinary tract infections
Septicemia
Reactive arthritis (rare and almost always
short-term)
Guillain-Barre syndrome, an unusual type
of paralysis (rare).

page.title:
Prevention
Prevention
page.enlisting:
CLEAN Wash hands before preparing or serving foods. Teach children to wash their hands after toileting and before eating. Wash all contact surfaces (e.g. cutting boards) Animal stools should also be considered to be contaminated. Wash after handling or close contact. (e.g. cleaning litter box). Wash hands after contact with animals in petting zoos.
CLEAN
Wash hands before preparing or serving foods.
Teach children to wash their hands after toileting
and before eating.
Wash all contact surfaces (e.g. cutting boards)
Animal stools should also be considered to be
contaminated. Wash after handling or close
contact. (e.g. cleaning litter box).
Wash hands after contact with animals in petting
zoos.

page.title:
Prevention
Prevention
page.enlisting:
Do not contaminate cooked foods with uncooked foods. Do not place cooked poultry/meat on cutting board which was used to prepare raw poultry/meat. How old is your cutting board?
Do not contaminate cooked foods with
uncooked foods.
Do not place cooked poultry/meat on
cutting board which was used to prepare
raw poultry/meat.
How old is your cutting board?

page.title:
Prevention
Prevention
page.enlisting:
COOK Be sure that meats and poultry are fully cooked using a meat thermometer Cook poultry to an internal temperature of o 165 Cook pork to an internal temperature of 145 Where is your meat thermometer?

page.title:
Prevention
Prevention
page.enlisting:
CHILL Refrigerate poultry and meats immediately. Keep poultry and other meats in refrigerator at 41oF or less. When was the last time you checked the temperature in your refrigerator?
CHILL
Refrigerate poultry and meats immediately.

page.title:
Prevention
Prevention
page.normal_text:
To protect the public, anyone who is infected with Campylobacter should not work as a food handler, patient care provider, dairy processor or child care provider until there is no longer a risk of infecting others.
To protect the public, anyone who is infected
with Campylobacter should not work as a w i t h

n o t

food handler, patient care provider, dairy
processor or child care provider until there
is no longer a risk of infecting others.
